atDirectives.name: @import
atDirectives.description: Use the `@import` directive to import other CSS files.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive to define theme values in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Use the `@source` directive to define source utilities in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Use the `@utility` directive to define custom utilities in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@variant` directive to create custom variants in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to create custom variants with custom selectors.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS. This is useful when you find a common utility pattern in your HTML that you'd like to extract to a new component.

atDirectives.name: @reference
atDirectives.description: Use the `@reference` directive to reference utility classes without applying them.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive for compatibility with older Tailwind versions.

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: Use the `@plugin` directive to add custom Tailwind plugins to your CSS.

properties.name: color-adjust
properties.description: The `color-adjust` property is used for backwards compatibility with Firefox versions 48-96. It helps control how browsers adjust colors during printing.
